column4: anyone know why there's such a lag after login (gnome) while the applets load?
maybe you got a lot of them, applets are slow in loading.
I log in from gdm. The desktop is displayed + the two gnome-panels, then about 5-10 seconds pass while the applets load, and until they load, I'm unable to do anything
yea that's a lot, have you try deleting them to be sure it's the applets?
it happens on my laptop, on my desktop, and on my wife's laptop...I thought it was normal...
the lag is normal it's loading a lot of things, but the times for you seem too much.
interesting. is there no way to have them start preloading while gdm is loaded waiting for input?
not in the way it's handle, whichs apps by the way?
normally python applets are very slow at loading, because of the interface
gnome-system-monitor, frequency scaling, and the normal "notifications"
oh yes the system monitor is laggy, I don't use it anymore because of that.
I see. any other recommendations for replacements/
depends on your geekiness lvl, I don't really use any at the moment, but http://conky.sourceforge.net/ it's really neat.
yeah, I've used conky before, I just always forget to install it...plus I like the desktop real estate it takes up. I was hoping for some other gnome-panel applet
well there is always  gkrellm , but that's isn't gnome's specific.
true true. thanks for the recommends & help
